title: Use the SURVIVAL Acronym for Decision Making
brief: Apply the 8-step SURVIVAL framework to systematically assess and respond to any survival situation.
steps: S - Size up the situation: Assess enemy activity, surroundings, your physical condition, and equipment.
U - Use all your senses and avoid undue haste: Plan moves carefully, observe sounds, smells, temperature changes.
R - Remember where you are: Know your location on map, relate to terrain, identify enemy/friendly areas and water sources.
V - Vanquish fear and panic: Control emotions through training and self-confidence.
I - Improvise: Use tools for multiple purposes, adapt natural objects for different needs.
V - Value living: Maintain strong will to survive through stubbornness and refusal to give up.
A - Act like the natives: Observe local people and animals for food, water, and shelter patterns.
L - Live by your wits: Apply learned survival skills and continue practicing them.
warnings: Acting in haste may cause you to lose equipment or become disoriented.
Animals cannot serve as absolute guides - many eat plants toxic to humans.
Animal reactions can reveal your presence to enemies.
